revised_title: On the Efficiency and Duty of Machines: A New Term in Mechanics
tldr: The author proposes a new term in mechanics called 'efficiency' to measure the work performed by machines, and applies this concept to the analysis of steam and recoil engines. He concludes that the recoil-engine cannot be used advantageously due to its lower efficiency and duty compared to other machines, and suggests that a more elastic fluid may improve mechanical power.
